comment._content: Thank you for the links, Penny!

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pixelwrangler] I'm not seeing the typo? The subject looks ok to me?

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Maybe "University of California (1868-1952)" is an established subject heading they use for anything related to the UCs before 1952? 1868 was the year the University of California was founded.  Not sure why 1952 is significant.

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Thanks, Penny -- your comment paved a way for me to return to sanity.  There's no doubt I misread and misunderstood "1868-1952" to mean the years Laurel van der Wal attended UC Berkeley, rather than "University of California (1868-1952)" being a subject – even though the word, Subject, was clearly there! My apology to the Smithsonian.
